I cannot post links until my 10th post. This will be the 10th, so I will link it in my next post. The article is titled.
 Changing the culture of violence is the key
 
 They grow up watching the people around them committing crimes, and such behavior becomes normalized. A kid that grows up with guns in the house that are used for hunting and self defense will learn that's what guns are for. A kid that grows up being exposed to guns being used to rob and kill will learn a very different lesson about what guns are for. The former will be disarmed by gun control laws because they have no plans to commit crimes and learn that laws are to be obeyed. The latter will not be affected at all by more gun control laws, because they already have easy access to guns through illegal channels and have no inclination to obey laws. If they did, they wouldn't be committing crimes in the first place. 
 
 The only way to stop the cycle of violence is to address the causes and stop the socialization. Morality, values, and discipline need to be instilled in the youth of America. The only way that can happen is by strengthening families and increasing the positive influences on their lives. All too often these troubled kids are left without adequate adult supervision, either due to imprisonment or overburdened work schedules. Absent parents, even if well equipped themselves, often cannot convey these concepts onto their children, so they grow up without them and learn their mores on the streets. Exacerbating the problem is the culture of the welfare state, where children grow up with welfare as a way of life and are accustomed to getting something for nothing. This often fosters a sense of entitlement. They've really never seen someone earn what they have through legitimate enterprises, so learn to idolize the criminal element who seemingly gain high status and material goods through illegal activities. 
 
 There are no easy solutions. Education must be reformed, family values rebuilt, the institute of marriage returned to a revered status, teachers better trained and empowered to teach not indoctrinate, and a government that understands it is there to serve, not rule. Gun control cannot and does not address any of these issues. Anyone who believes otherwise is deluding themselves into seeking a futile path towards stopping the violence. A gun can be an instrument to commit a crime, or it can be an instrument to stop a crime. It is the person behind it who chooses, and it is the person behind it who needs the change, not the law.

 
 To those who are sympathetic to gun control. Can we get anyone to listen and change society, ooooor will you just use this problem, and these under trained and under socialized kids to persecute the 2nd Amendment!
